messages: a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (16:49): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: do you develop on / have ready access to a Linux box?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:50): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: I don't develop on Linux. I have a VM in the office and a real but slow Linux box at home.
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (16:52): http://svn.versiondude.net/whattf/htmlparser/trunk/ruby-gcj/test/domencoding.rb
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (16:53): doesn't do much yet, but is wrapping a Java Document in Ruby and exposing a method on that Ruby object that extracts data from the underlying Java object.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:54): is encoding the data?
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (16:54): yes: String *encoding = jdoc->getXmlEncoding();
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (16:56): I've been slowed down by two Ubuntu/gcj/jaxp bugs... but if I'm past them, it is now simply a matter of adding more objects and more methods.
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (16:56): I've only tested it so far on Ubuntu and Fedora; don't know what it would take to reproduce on OSX or Windows.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:13): gcjh -force -o headers/DomUtils.h -cp /usr/share/java/libgcj-4.3.jar:classes DomUtils
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:13): rake aborted!
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:13): Command failed with status (127): [gcjh -force -o headers/DomUtils.h -cp /usr...]
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:14): debian linux
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:14): testing/unstable
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:14): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: I just need to run "rake" in the build dir?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:14): or is there a configure step?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:14): opens the README
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:14): rake runs extconf... checking.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:14): maybe I need ruby-dev
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:15): not sure I have it
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:15): that shouldn't cause gcjh to fail
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:16): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: actually, I think I had no gcj
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:16): because I removed it
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:16): that would cause gcjh to fail :-)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:17): gcj package pulls in dependencies like that fastjar thing, that screw with existing tools
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:17): in that they don't behave like the stuff they are supposed to replace
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:19): anyway, now installing fastjar gcj-4.3 libecj-java libecj-java-gcj libgcj9-dev
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:22): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: BTW I looked in Opera 6 + 7 and couldn't see an outline toolbar
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:23): s/toolbar/tool/
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:23): (but it is quite likely I missed something)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:26): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Netscape used to have it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:26): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: And maybe early Moz suite too?

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:26): and libnu-* stuff
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:27): doesn't do much yet, but the rest should be cookie-cutter
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:27): now tries "rake test"
